title: Lakhimpur Kheri violence: Respond to allegations, says SC to accused Ashish Mishra
desc: The Supreme Court has directed Ashish Mishra, accused in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case, to address witness intimidation allegations. Mishra, currently on bail, was arrested for his involvement in the death of eight people, including protesting farmers, who were run over by vehicles in his father's convoy. The court's order follows the presentation of photographs allegedly depicting witness threats.

title: Cyclone Fengal: How it got its name, landfall, weather warnings, and impact on Tamil Nadu
desc: Cyclone Fengal, intensifying in the Bay of Bengal, is projected to hit Tamil Nadu's coast after grazing Sri Lanka. Heavy rainfall has already impacted crops, prompting school closures in several districts. Authorities are on high alert as the storm progresses, with the IMD forecasting further downpours and potential flooding.

title: Rains continue in Tamil Nadu, standing crops hit in Cauvery delta areas
desc: Heavy rains lashed Tamil Nadu's Cauvery delta, damaging crops and affecting salt pans. Schools and colleges closed in several districts. NDRF teams deployed. Opposition leader urged government relief for affected farmers. IMD predicts cyclonic storm formation and more heavy rainfall.

title: UP achieves record paddy procurement under Kharif season 2024-25
desc: Uttar Pradesh's paddy procurement for 2024-25 has exceeded 7.28 lakh metric tons, a significant jump from last year's 5.79 lakh metric tons by the same period. Over 105,000 farmers have received Rs 1,464 crore in payments within 48 hours, facilitated by 4,215 procurement centers. Chief Minister Yogi Aditynath emphasised transparency and efficiency in the process.

title: India's milk production up 4% to record 239.3 MT in FY24, despite fall in output of buffaloes
desc: India's milk production reached a record 239.30 million tonnes in 2023-24. This is a 4% increase. Per capita milk availability rose to 471 grams per day. The government celebrated National Milk Day. The focus is on bringing dairy farmers into the organized sector. The government aims to eradicate livestock diseases by 2030. This will boost dairy exports.

title: Farmers bets more heavily on cotton in Brazil's newest farming region
desc: Cotton growing continues to make inroads in the sprawling farms around Luis Eduardo Magalhaes in the western part of Bahia state, where the "cerradp" (savannah) climate predominates. The well-defined wet and dry periods have made the region a natural expansion place for cotton growing.

title: Punjab: Farmers from Shambhu to march towards Delhi on December 6
desc: Farmers protesting at the Shambhu border plan to march to Delhi on December 6th to demand guaranteed minimum support prices for their crops. They criticize the BJP for using divisive tactics during elections and urge Prime Minister Modi to address the violence in Manipur. The farmers have been protesting for 284 days and have blocked several highways in Punjab.

title: Climate finance is failing farmers punished by global warming
desc: While COP28 acknowledged the role of food systems in climate change, COP29's focus seems less pronounced.

title: Samunnati ties up with Northern Farmers Mega FPO to boost sustainable agriculture
desc: Samunnati has partnered with Northern Farmers Mega FPO to empower over 50 Farmer Producer Organizations in northern India. The collaboration will focus on sustainable farming practices, market access, and converting paddy straw waste into clean energy, addressing pollution concerns and boosting agricultural prosperity.

title: Rahul forced Centre to hear everyone in Parliament, says Surjewala; bats for soybean farmers
desc: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala accused the BJP of stifling parliamentary discussions and stated that Rahul Gandhi had compelled the government to engage with all parties. Surjewala also criticized the government's handling of soybean procurement in Maharashtra, claiming that farmers were facing significant losses due to low Minimum Support Prices.

title: MVA to take historic steps for farmers of Maharashtra: Rahul Gandhi
desc: Rahul Gandhi, Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha, announced that the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) plans to establish a minimum support price of Rs 7,000 per quintal plus bonus for soyabean in Maharashtra.

title: UP CM Yogi Adityanath highlights progress and challenges in empowering farmers at Krishi Bharat 2024
desc: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath inaugurated the Krishi Bharat 2024 program in Lucknow, emphasizing the integration of technology and entrepreneurship in agriculture. The event, featuring over 250 exhibitors, showcases advancements in agriculture, dairy, and food processing, attracting farmers and visitors. Two MoUs were signed between Uttar Pradesh and the Netherlands, the event's partner country, to foster agricultural collaboration.

title: Budget delay 'exposes' CM Naidu's 'super six' failures: Jagan Mohan Reddy
desc: YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, YSRCP Chief, has accused Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu of delaying the budget presentation to avoid scrutiny of unfulfilled poll promises. Reddy claims the eight-month delay, relying on vote-on-account budgets, was a tactic to hide the government's failure to deliver on the 'Super Six' schemes promised in the TDP's 2024 manifesto.

title: INDIA bloc to pay more to women, farmers than BJP gave to its 'billionaire friends': Rahul Gandhi
desc: Rahul Gandhi, speaking for the INDIA bloc, pledged to increase financial support for women, youth, farmers, and the poor in Jharkhand. He highlighted the alliance's commitment by announcing a raise in the monthly honorarium for women under the Maiyaa Samman Yojana to Rs 2,500, starting December 2024.

title: What is BJP doing to prevent farmer suicides in Maharashtra, Congress asks PM Modi
desc: Ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's rallies in Maharashtra, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh questioned the BJP's efforts in addressing farmer suicides and water scarcity in the state. Ramesh highlighted the plight of farmers and the inadequate support from the government, contrasting it with Congress's pro-farmer policies.

title: BJP doing politics: Karnataka minister Priyank Kharge on Waqf Board row
desc: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge accused the BJP of playing politics over the Waqf Board land claims issue. The claims, affecting farmers, temples, and historical sites, have sparked controversy. The government has ordered a halt to land mutation processes and the withdrawal of eviction notices.

title: With bypolls staring Congress in face, Govt orders withdrawal of Waqf notices issued to farmers
desc: The Karnataka government has ordered the immediate withdrawal of all notices issued to farmers and citizens asserting the Waqf Board's ownership of their land. This move comes amidst bypolls and strong opposition from the BJP and JDS, who have made it a major campaign issue.

title: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya, editors of Kannada news portals booked for allegedly spreading fake news
desc: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya and Kannada news portals face legal action for allegedly spreading misinformation about a farmer's suicide. Surya linked the death to land disputes with the Waqf Board, a claim refuted by police who cited loan and crop loss as the cause. Surya later deleted his social media post based on the news reports.

title: Waqf row: JPC chairman meets farmers in Karnataka, Congress lashes out
desc: Jagdambika Pal, Chairman of the Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) on the Waqf Amendment Bill, visited Karnataka to address farmers' claims that the Waqf board is laying claim to their land. Farmers allege that despite possessing land for generations, the Waqf board is asserting ownership. Pal aims to investigate these claims and submit a comprehensive report.

title: Waqf properties row: JPC Chairman receives over 500 petitions from aggrieved farmers in Karnataka
desc: Farmers in Karnataka's northern districts submitted over 500 petitions to Jagdambika Pal, Chairman of the Joint Committee of Parliament on the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, alleging their lands were wrongly classified as Waqf properties. Pal, joined by BJP MP Tejasvi Surya, assured the farmers their concerns would be addressed. Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar criticized the visit as politically motivated.

title: Waqf row: JPC Chairman in Karnataka on "fact finding", to meet aggrieved persons
desc: Jagdambika Pal, Chairman of the Joint Committee of Parliament on the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, is visiting Karnataka to address farmers' concerns over land claims by the State Waqf Board. Accompanied by MP Tejasvi Surya, Pal aims to gather facts and meet aggrieved farmers alleging misclassification of their lands as Waqf properties, prompting protests and government intervention.

title: Waqf notices to farmers in Karnataka: JPC chairman to visit Hubballi, Vijayapura and Belagavi tomorrow
desc: Jagdambika Pal, chairman of the Joint Parliamentary Committee on the Waqf (amendment) Bill, 2024, will visit Hubballi, Vijayapura and Belagavi on Thursday. He will interact with farmers impacted by Waqf notices claiming ownership of their land. Over 50 farmer organizations will present their concerns. The government's promise to withdraw notices and reverse mutations remains unconfirmed. BJP MPs continue their protest, demanding action against Waqf claims on private and government properties.

title: JPC chairman Jagdambika Pal to visit K'taka on Nov 7 to meet farmers protesting Waqf notices
desc: Jagdambika Pal, Chairman of the Joint Committee of Parliament on the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, will be visiting Karnataka. He will meet with farmers who were served notices over alleged encroachment on Waqf properties. The notices have since been withdrawn. Pal will also meet with Karnataka BJP leaders. The BJP has raised concerns over the issue.

title: Karnataka CM trying to distract farmers during by-elections: BJP's Bommai on retraction of notices related to Waqf land
desc: Former Karnataka Chief Minister Basavraj Bommai criticizes state government's retraction of waqf land notices, calling it a diversion during by-elections. BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla and LoP Chalavadi Narayanaswamy also term the move as an attempt to win votes, urging the withdrawal of the 1974 gazette.

title: Congress government ended 'darkness' in 11 months of rule in Telangana: CM Revanth Reddy rebuts PM Modi's remark
desc: The Congress government in Telangana has transformed the state in the last 11 months. Key initiatives include free bus travel for women, a healthcare cover of Rs 10 lakhs, a massive farmer loan waiver, free electricity for women, and significant job recruitment. The government is also rejuvenating water bodies and ensuring overall development.

title: My statement was twisted, says DK Shivkumar after Kharge pulls up Karnataka govt
desc: DK Shivakumar retracted his remarks about possibly reviewing Karnataka's 'Shakti' scheme, which offers free bus travel to women, following criticism from Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge. Shivakumar claimed his statement was twisted and emphasized his respect for elders' decisions. The 'Shakti' scheme is part of the Congress government's initiatives in Karnataka.

title: BJP politicising issue: Karnataka Dy CM Shivakumar on Waqf land claim controversy
desc: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah assured no farmers will be evicted amid the Waqf land controversy. Despite BJP allegations, the CM clarified that eviction notices have been withdrawn. Deputy CM DK Shivakumar accused BJP of politicizing the issue, reaffirming that farmers’ rights to their land will be protected. Home Minister G Parmeshwara confirmed the resolution of the issue.

title: We will withdraw notices, says Siddaramaiah on Waqf Board’s claims over farmland
desc: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah assured farmers in Vijayapura, Yadgir and Dharwad that no one will be evicted from their land and any issued notices will be withdrawn. He accused the BJP of spreading misinformation and clarified that no notices claiming farmland as Waqf property were issued under the current government. BJP has pledged to fight for farmers' rights.

title: Ready go to for jail for the sake of farmers: BRS leader K T Rama Rao
desc: KT Rama Rao criticized Congress and BJP for not fulfilling election promises at a farmers' rally in Adilabad. He pledged to fight for farmers, even if it means going to jail. Rama Rao highlighted unfulfilled promises like the revival of CCI plant, financial aid to farmers, and job creation, stating there's no difference between Congress and BJP.
